festival.introText:
Reggae Land 2023 is going to be bigger and better than ever before as it moves to the legendary “The Milton Keynes National Bowl”. Taking place on 5th and 6th August there will be a heavyweight lineup of artists from across the reggae and dub spectrum with both red-hot new stars, enduring pioneers and plenty of legends all playing in a family-friendly and authentic Caribbean wonderland. Tickets are on sale Friday November 4th via Skiddle and will sell out, so do not sleep.

 

Last year's Reggae Land was the best yet and, as if to prove it, was nominated in three different categories in the UK Festival Awards 2022. After its unrivalled success, it made sense to supersize the festival which has now outgrown its original venue. As such, this year's celebration of all things reggae moves to The Milton Keynes National Bowl which has been the site of many magical moments in musical history from the 80s onwards. The likes of Queen, David Bowie, Metallica, Dizzie Rascal and Foo Fighters have all played epic shows there and now Reggae Land becomes part of the illustrious story.

 

There is no other experience as authentic as Reggae Land. Over two days it offers 50 artists over four stages which will cover the very best in dub, reggae and dancehall. But also there is so much more than music. There will be a Reggae Flea market, a fairground, an entire Carnival Float stage along with dancers, VIP zone, festival merchandise, mouth-watering Caribbean Food Village as well as plenty of drinks in the Rum Shacks, Gin Bars and Caribbean cocktail bars.

 

The family friendly Reggae Land 2023 will unveil its full line-up soon but prepare to be wowed as things enter a new chapter at The Milton Keynes National Bowl. Sign up for your tickets now for this unmissable celebration at Reggae Land.
festival.location: The National Bowl in Milton Keynes

reviews.title: Review of The Milton Keynes Reggae Festival
Review of Reggae Land 2022
reviews.body: awesome definitely going again next year

reviews.title: Review of Reggae Land 2022
reviews.body: The event was Really good I enjoyed it very much however I paid for VIP on the Saturday and it was a waste of time, I should have only paid for the standard. VIP you couldn't hear or see the Bands/Stands, the sounds were distorted, the toilets were filthy and the Bar didn't have enough staff on it to warrant, VIP status. What was the point? Apart from that, it was  a great weekend event

reviews.title: Review of Reggae Land 2022
reviews.body: VIP needs a couple of food outlets aswell as the rum bus c**ktail  and Que jump needs to be better sign posted

reviews.title: Review of Reggae Land 2022
reviews.body:
Very nice But the local band support to the Artists are not very GOOD. Examples- Eek-a-mouse, Shaggy & Third World.
Try to be better 
Or else Nice Atmosphere & Nice People

reviews.title: Review of Reggae Land 2022
reviews.body: The sound on the main stage could have been better. At times, it was loud and at others it was tinny and didn't highlight the artists very well. Really nice group of artists - the atmosphere was amazing! But the drinks prices were a joke. We had food from one of the seafood stalls and it was unbelievable. Good price too! Will definitely be coming back next year.

faqs.question: When is Milton Keynes Reggae Festival 2023?
faqs.answer: Reggae Land 2023 will take place over Saturday 5th August and Sunday 6th August 2023.

faqs.question: How much are Milton Keynes Reggae Festival tickets?
faqs.answer: Tickets start from £29.50 + BF for a day ticket or £59 + BF for a weekend ticket. The earlier you purchase tickets, the cheaper you will get them.

faqs.question: Will there be any disabled parking?
faqs.answer: No, there is no disabled parking on site, but there is disabled parking in the immediate area surrounding the site.

faqs.question: Does Milton Keynes Reggae Festival have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: No, Milton Keynes Reggae Festival is a non-camping festival so camping equipment is not needed. It is directly in the centre of Milton Keynes, so there are plenty of alternative accomadation to choose from.

faqs.question: Parking your car at Reggae Land
faqs.answer:
Unfortunately, at Reggae Land we do not have any customer parking. However, there are lots of areas around Campbell Park where car parks are situated, and the City Centre is only a short distance away with more parking spots at your disposal. We would recommend you arrive early to make sure you find a decent car park space as the roads around the festival will be busy.

PLEASE DO NOT PARK ON AVEBURY BOULEVARD. We ask all attendees to refrain from parking on the main road outside of the festival site. Residents live across the road and do not appreciate this and when the festival ends, this makes it dangerous for other attendees who will be on foot/public transport. Please keep each other in mind! We are a family festival of togetherness, and we must take each other in to consideration.

Public transport routes: Milton Keynes Central train station and bus terminal is around a 33min walk to the festival site or if you can take a taxi which is approximately a 7min journey.

Please see below a list of public car parks available for use which range from between 4-10 mins walk from the festival site:

- Theatre District (Stop B4,

- Milton Keynes MK9 3QA

- 70 N Twelfth St,

- Milton Keynes MK9 3BT

- NCP. N Eleventh St,

- Milton Keynes MK9 3BU

- Secklow Gate, 602S 10th St,

- Milton Keynes MK9 3DG

faqs.question: Where is Milton Keynes Reggae Festival?
faqs.answer: Reggae Land will be located at The Milton Keynes National Bowl.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer:
Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.

Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Will there be anydisabled toilet facilities?
faqs.answer: Yes, disabled toilets are clearly signposted and available on site.

faqs.question: Does Milton Keynes Reggae Festival have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer:
If you are under the age of 18, you must always be accompanied by an adult. Food and soft drinks and lots of entertainment is available throughout the weekend festival to enjoy.

CHALLENGE 25! We have a challenge 25 in place. Anyone who looks under the age of 25 will be asked to show proof of I.D if they’re buying alcoholic drinks. Please don’t be offended if our staff ask you for I.D, you’re one of the lucky ones!

We are a family festival! Reggae is all about community, togetherness, love, peace, and unity, and at Reggae Land you will find an abundance of this. If you have any questions, please e-mail hello@jbmmusic.com

faqs.question: Is there personal assistant tickets available?
faqs.answer: If you would like to apply for a personal assistant ticket for Wheelchair or Ambulant Disabled Access. Proof of disability must be provided by emailing hello@jbmmusic.com

faqs.question: What can I bring with me?
faqs.answer:
Drink

We have a zero-tolerance policy on any alcoholic liquids being brought onto our site. We allow attendees to bring sealed bottles of water only. Our on-site bars and traders will be selling a wide selection of drinks from beers, ciders, spirits, and soft drinks. You will also find cocktail and gins bars on our site...yes, lots to choose from!

Reggae Land will be operating a cashless system this year. You will be able to buy all food and drinks via chip & pin or contactless. If you will be heading to Reggae Land with cash, this must be exchanged for tokens at our token booths which will be clearly sign posted on-site.

 

Free Water

There will be free water on-site that you can fill up your water bottles with. We allow customers to bring in an empty water bottle on entry. We ask all attendees to make sure they stay hydrated all day! This festival is in the peak of summer, and we expect warm, summer weather so please take care of yourselves and if you feel under the weather at all, please head to our medical/welfare tent.

faqs.question: Is the festival accessible for me if I have disability requirements?
faqs.answer:
Reggae Land & JBM Music aim to make our sites as accessible as possible for all walks of life. For all access tickets purchased, we can offer 1x free carer ticket, so you have someone to help you throughout our two-day festival!

We have disabled toilets, seating dotted around the site and an access area for those who have purchased an accessible ticket.

Our festival is located on a green site. Due to the to the great British weather, this can become a bit of a problem if you are a wheelchair user. Our site layout has been designed with accessible customers in mind and we will help wherever possible on the day. Please contact us if you have any specific access requirements and we will aim to help you the best we can. Please e-mail hello@jbmmusic.com if you have any queries.

faqs.question: Do you have the site map available?
faqs.answer: We will upload our site map on this section once complete

faqs.question: Drugs Policy
faqs.answer:
We operate a ZERO DRUGS POLICY. We do not allow any drugs on our site, and anyone caught with illegal substances will be ejected from our site or even handed over to the local authorities.

If you have any prescribed medical conditions, you will need to hand these to our on-site welfare team who will look after them and if needed, please head to them and they will be more than happy to assist.

faqs.question: Medical & Welfare
faqs.answer: Our site will be well equipped with a medical and welfare team to assist you if needed at any point during your time at Reggae Land. If you feel unwell, we advise you to make your way to the medical tent and our experienced team will be happy to help. This will be clearly sign posted on the day and you can see this on our site map above.

faqs.question: I want to get involved! How can I work/volunteer/trade at the Festival?
faqs.answer:
TRADERS: Please e-mail trader@jbmmusic.com if you feel you have a suitable stall that you would like to pitch up at Reggae Land. You must be certified to serve food and hold all the necessary H&S certificates. Our team will send over more details upon your application.

VOLUNTEERS: YES! We love to help and give back to the local community. If you are interested in volunteering at Reggae Land, please e-mail hello@jbmmusic.com with subject ‘VOLUNTEER: Reggae Land’ and one of our team can assist.

WORK: We are now recruiting bar staff, steward staff and much more for Reggae Land and more events we’re hosting across the UK. Please e-mail hello@jbmmusic.com with subject heading ‘FESTIVAL STAFF: Working at Reggae Land’

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Reggae Land 2022
reviewsDisplayFour.body: awesome definitely going again next year

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Reggae Land 2022
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Really lovely vibe at the venue and a great atmosphere.  Many people came out of town to Milton Keynes for this event.   The only sad thing was the highly extortionate cost of the alcohol and food which was a total rip off.

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Reggae Land 2022
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Absolutely bangin' what a weekend. Not only am I coming back next year I'm bringing at least 20 people with me. Really was a great event and even the portaloos were decent (a hand washing station would have been helpful but we had soap and water so no harm done).

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Reggae Land 2022
reviewsDisplayFour.body:
loved the event 
Great line-up 
would have liked more vegan options that aren't spicy 
Disney queue was a bit overkill 
track down to bowl stage was an accident waiting to happen  - way to crowded and funnelled 
over all loved the festival and I will be coming next year

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Reggae Land 2022
reviewsDisplayFour.body: I was slightly disappointed with the disabled facilities... My daughter is a wheelchair user and we found it rather tricky in places.. We didn't find any accessible toilets we had to squish and manually handle into regular portaloos and struggled to find safe areas that she was able to access... We were VIP too but she couldn't see over the bush...

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Reggae Land 2022
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Absolutely fabulous. I attend many reggae festivals across the globe. i love live music. First visit to Reggae Land did not disappoint. Well put together. I will attend again and recommend to others .

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Reggae Land 2022
reviewsDisplayFour.body: The Vibe was Amazing, cant wait till the next one.

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Reggae Land 2022
reviewsDisplayFour.body:
I had the most amazing time loved it ! 
I would just say the sound levels weren't great or leveled properly and it did let some of the artists down. it would also be great to able to camp, if you have paid for the full weekend so we don't have to queue again and you don't have to search everyone again/ shorter queues. Also it might be worth making a spot undercover incase it rains or very hot. and more water points. we all had a fantastic time and absolutely loved it, thank you!

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Reggae Land 2022
reviewsDisplayFour.body:
My only criticism is that I had to go back to the entrance, because I was not given a wrist band. As prove that I was VIP vistor. Also the VIP sign was not clearly marked, I had so much (including others)problem in finding the entrance. I asked one of the security staff he did not, know either. 
Apart from that, I had a FANTASTIC TIME.
Thank you abundantly to each and everyone for their hard work in making this event possible. Jah Bless.

news.title: Reggae Land announces full lineup
news.summary: The full lineup for Reggae Land festival has just been released.
